info.title: DMS API
info.description:
DMS API (.NET 6.0) 97-0007828 OpenAPI Specification This API provides full access to the Siemens VEMS Data Management System (DMS).
API endpoints are also protected with authorization that requires a valid JWT token to be provided. The token should be provided by the provided Keycloak instance. The DMS API will only validate the token, it will not refresh the token or direct the user to an interface to re-authenticate an invalid token.
Valid tokens are further restricted based on user roles:
  • Accounts in the dms_user role will have access to all endpoints, with the "GET" and "POST:*/search" methods available.
  • Accounts in the dms_admin role can use any method available to users in the dms_user role. dms_admins can also:
    • Update or create vehicles,
    • Update or create trains, and
    • Update parameter configuration
Usage information is provided in the endpoint descriptions below. For example, measurement results are obtained using the results timeseries search endpoint.

not that the application successfully performed the action.
Please refer to events to determine if the application has successfully completed the requested action.

post.summary: Search for results in hierarchical format.
post.description: Search for results in the hierarchical format using the flexible search query tooling. Example query for getting guide tyre results from 2022/07/26 10:33:00 onwards:      {       \"query\": {           \"range\": {               \"pass_online_timestamp\": {                   \"greater_than_equals\": 1658831580000               }           }       },       \"component_queries\": {           \"component_category\": [\"GuideTyre\"]       },       \"sort\": [\"-pass_online_timestamp\"],       \"limit\": 500,       \"total\": true     }  Filter for 20 newest results skipping the first 10 results:      {       \"sort\": [\"-pass_online_timestamp\"],       \"limit\": 20,       \"offset\": 10,       \"total\": true     }  Filter for specific pass data:      {       \"query\": {         \"term\": {           \"pass_pass_id\": \"<Pass Id>\"         }       },       \"limit\": 500,       \"total\": true     }  Note, the default maximum number of results returned in a query is 500. To see how many results are present in excess of the returned number, set \"total\" to true.

200.description: List of train result schema as a response

403.description: 403 response to indicate the session doesn't have the required scope to perform the REST request.

post.summary: Search and return results in time-series format.
post.description: Search for results in the time-series format using the flexible search query tooling. Example query for getting guide tyre results from 2022/07/26 10:33:00 onwards:      {       \"query\": {           \"range\": {               \"pass_online_timestamp\": {                   \"greater_than_equals\": 1658831580000               }           }       },       \"component_queries\": {           \"component_category\": [\"GuideTyre\"]       },       \"sort\": [\"-pass_online_timestamp\"],       \"limit\": 500,       \"total\": true     }  Filter for 20 newest results skipping the first 10 results:      {       \"sort\": [\"-pass_online_timestamp\"],       \"limit\": 20,       \"offset\": 10,       \"total\": true     }  Filter for specific pass data:      {       \"query\": {         \"term\": {           \"pass_pass_id\": \"<Pass Id>\"         }       },       \"limit\": 500,       \"total\": true     }  Note, the default maximum number of results returned in a query is 500. To see how many results are present in excess of the returned number, set \"total\" to true.

File upload endpoint, with the following restrictions:
  • File must be one of the following file types: ".jpg", ".jpeg", ".png", ".csv", ".pdf"

A 400 response will be returned if the above restrictions are broken.

Remove.description: Remove permissions for this resource. User must still have role level permissions for resource deletion.

dms_apis.Models.DTO.AclDTO.description: ACL permissions provided for this resource. By default, the creator of a resource has full control barring role based restrictions. In addition, if a resource has a direct parent, then it will inherit any ACL settings on that parent.

name.description: Name of the parameter for this measurement.

confidence.description: A rating from 0 - 4 on processor confidence in the measurement. If 5, then confidence is undefined.

confidence_description.description: A human readable field for the confidence field.

status.description: Status of the measurement. If 0 it is \"OK\", if 1 it is \"Not Measured\", if 12 it is \"Component Missing\".

status_description.description: A human readable field for the status field.

expected_count.description: Optional field to indicate the expected number of times this parameter set is expected to be used in a result set. Only used in \"Many\" Parameter Set Types

dms_apis.Models.DTO.ParameterSetTypeDTO.description:
Gets or Sets ParameterSetType

Single

Many

valid_range.description:
DMS valid parameter settings format. For array results, the parameter setting will be applied to each member of that array. Example inputs:
  • true
  • false
  • [0,12]
  • (12,18]
  • (0,40)
  • [0,1] [2,3] [4,5]

alarm.description:
DMS valid parameter settings format. For array results, the parameter setting will be applied to each member of that array. Example inputs:
  • true
  • false
  • [0,12]
  • (12,18]
  • (0,40)
  • [0,1] [2,3] [4,5]

monitor.description:
DMS valid parameter settings format. For array results, the parameter setting will be applied to each member of that array. Example inputs:
  • true
  • false
  • [0,12]
  • (12,18]
  • (0,40)
  • [0,1] [2,3] [4,5]

derivation_priority.description: Priority for derived parameters, important for derived parameters that rely on each other. 0 is highest priority and default.

Decreasing

timestamp.description: Number of milliseconds elapsed since the UNIX epoch.

dms_apis.Models.DTO.PassDirectionDTO.description:
Direction the train(s) are travelling into the system. Please refer to external documentation for meaning of Incoming and Outgoing for a site.

Incoming

Outgoing

total_expected.description: Number of component measurements expected within a pass

valid.description: Number of component measurements marked as a valid classification (typically ok + monitor + alarm)

ok.description: Number of component measurements that have an result that is valid and not alarming

monitor.description: Number of component measurements in the zone designated for monitoring

alarm.description: Number of component measurements in the zone designated for alarms, if a component has both an alarmed measurement and an invalid measurement then it will be included in the alarm count

invalid.description: Number of component measurements marked as invalid

not_measured.description: Number of components that were not measured

partly_measured.description: Number of component that were partly measured

component_missing.description: Number of components marked as missing (note, this is not the same as \"not measured\"), not all subsystems will have this field

ok.description: Number of component measurements that have an result that is valid and not alarming

monitor.description: Number of component measurements in the zone designated for monitoring

alarm.description: Number of component measurements in the zone designated for alarms, if a component has both an alarmed measurement and an invalid measurement then it will be included in the alarm count

valid.description: Number of component measurements considered valid, typically ok, monitor and alarm measurements

invalid.description: Number of component measurements which have invalid measurements, if a component has both an alarmed measurement and an invalid measurement then it will be included in the alarm count

not_measured.description: Number of component measurements that have not been measured

partly_measured.description: Number of component measurements which have only partially been measured, if a component has both an alarmed measurement and a partial measurement then it will be included in the alarm count

component_missing.description: Number of components marked as missing (note, this is not the same as \"not measured\"), not all subsystems will have this field

total.description: Number of component measurements involved in the pass

threshold_value.description: The threshold exceeded by the measurement value

dms_apis.Models.DTO.ResultImportModeType.description:
The mode field tells the DMS to either import a COMPLETE set of results, APPEND to an existing set or REPLACE any results already in the database.

Complete

Append

Replace

name.description: Name of the parameter for this measurement.

confidence.description: A rating from 0 - 4 on processor confidence in the measurement. If 5, then confidence is undefined.

confidence_description.description: A human readable field for the confidence field.

status.description: Status of the measurement. If 0 it is \"OK\", if 1 it is \"Not Measured\", if 12 it is \"Component Missing\".

status_description.description: A human readable field for the status field.

datum_id.description: Optional datum id field specifying the relevant datum for the measurement

sub_name.description: Optional extension to parameter name when multiple measurements for a parameter occur

dms_apis.Models.DTO.ResultImportTrainDir.description:
The train direction with respect to the agreed System convention

Incoming

Outgoing

sort.description: Fields to sort as a list. Maximum 5 fields allowed. Prefix fields with `-` to indicate descending order.

total.description: Indicate whether a total count is required for get requests.

or.description: Combine two or more filter queries using a logical disjunction.

range.description: Test a provided term using specified inequalities.

term.description: Test a provided term using equality.

contains.description: Test if a string term contains a sub string.

last_cal_val.description: Number of milliseconds elapsed since the UNIX epoch.

total_expected.description: Number of component measurements expected within a pass

valid.description: Number of component measurements marked as a valid classification (typically ok + monitor + alarm)

ok.description: Number of component measurements that have an result that is valid and not alarming

monitor.description: Number of component measurements in the zone designated for monitoring

alarm.description: Number of component measurements in the zone designated for alarms, if a component has both an alarmed measurement and an invalid measurement then it will be included in the alarm count

invalid.description: Number of component measurements marked as invalid

not_measured.description: Number of components that were not measured

partly_measured.description: Number of component that were partly measured

component_missing.description: Number of components marked as missing (note, this is not the same as \"not measured\"), not all subsystems will have this field

pass_id.description: PCS generated pass id for the data (note, the DMS independently generates an id for each pass that is not associated with this id)

timestamp.description: Number of milliseconds elapsed since the UNIX epoch.

sequence_number.description: Index of processing generator for this measurement
